questions.text: What was the name of Reno Raines' girlfriend that was shot when she took the bullet meant for Reno in the pilot episode of "Renegade"?
questions.explanation:
Valerie.

	Valerie Prentiss was engaged to Reno. While at their motel in Bay City, a former prison inmate that Reno put away was released and tried to kill Reno. Valerie was shot, pronounced brain dead, and put on life support. Reno used the money he made from catching bounties to help pay for Valerie's medical care. Val passed away in the first season episode, "Val's Song".

questions.text: What country music star played a bail jumper who showed Reno what life would have been like had he died instead of his fiancée in "The Road Not Taken"?
questions.explanation:
Johnny Cash.

	Johnny Cash played Henry Travis who took Reno through what life would have been like had he died instead of Valerie. Reno found that Sixkiller Enterprises was a bathing suit shop, Bobby was a hired thug for Dutch Dixon, and Cheyenne had committed suicide. While searching for Val, Reno found her married with an infant.

questions.text: What was the relationship of bounty hunters Bobby Sixkiller and Cheyenne Phillips, who caught Reno Raines in the pilot episode of "Renegade"?
questions.explanation:
Stepbrother and stepsister.

	Bobby Sixkiller and Cheyenne Phillips were stepbrother and stepsister. Cheyenne's mother, Amanda, moved with Cheyenne to teach on an Indian reservation. Amanda married Bobby's father. Cheyenne said in "Once Burned, Twice Chey" that her mother didn't change her name to Sixkiller because Cheyenne Sixkiller was too much name.

questions.text: From where did Cheyenne Phillips get Reno's alias, Vince Black?
questions.explanation:
Obituaries.

	When Cheyenne updated all of Reno's phony information for him, Reno finally asked where she got all the information. Cheyenne told him his driver's license number was her phone number backward, his address was courtesy of her aunt Terry, and his name came from the obituaries. In the second season finale "Carrick O'Quinn", it was mentioned that the name Vince Black was also the name of a motorcycle.  FYI, with 110 episodes filmed of "Renegade", Reno Raines had kissed over ninety women on the series.

questions.text: What police force did Reno Raines work for before he moved to Bay City to help with an Internal Affairs investigation into some dirty cops?
questions.explanation:
San Diego.

	In the pilot episode of "Renegade", Reno Raines was brought to Bay City by his friend Harry Wells as an undercover cop in an Internal Affairs sting on some dirty cops. Unfortunately, the cop who Reno was talking to about his undercover operation was a dirty cop named Donald Dixon. The cop set up Reno to be killed and when the plan failed, Dixon set Reno up to be framed for murder.

questions.text: Arlene Dahl (mother to series regular Lorenzo Lamas) played the mother of Reno Raines in two episodes of "Renegade".
questions.explanation:
False.

	Arlene Dahl did play in two episodes of "Renegade", but she didn't play Reno's mother. Arlene played Virginia Biddle in the episode "Family Ties" and Elaine Carlisle in "Sex, Lies, and Activewear".  FYI, Bobby's full name was finally revealed in the series finale as Robert JosephStandingBear Sixkiller.

questions.text: In "Fighting Cage", Reno saw his brother Mitch fight an opponent in a cage fight. Why couldn't he believe it was Mitch on the TV screen?
questions.correct: He thought Mitch died in the war
options: Reno didn't know he had a brother
questions.explanation:
He thought Mitch died in the war.

	Reno told Bobby and Cheyenne that his brother died in the war, but the VCR tape they watched showed Mitch fighting in a cage fight. Cheyenne and Reno went undercover to find out how Mitch was alive and why he was in a cage fight. This was the first two part episode for "Renegade" and the first season finale.  FYI, in the episode "Love Hurts", Amanda Sixkiller was seen reading a Stephen Cannell novel by the pool.

questions.text: Bobby won an award in "Bounty Hunter of the Year". His acceptance speech was comprised of one word. What was his speech?
questions.explanation:
"Thanks".

	While writing his speech, Bobby came to realize that he couldn't mention certain cases because of Reno's involvement and others because they promised not to speak of them. In the end, Bobby's speech was a simple thanks.

questions.text: In what season of "Renegade" was Reno captured, convicted and sent to prison?
questions.explanation:
Season 3.

	Season three of "Renegade" opened with a three part episode. In "Dutch on the Run", Reno was caught by Dutch Dixon; in "The Trial of Reno Raines" Reno was sentenced to prison, and in "Escape" Reno escaped prison during a planned prison break.

questions.text: Tables turned for Reno in "The Bad Seed" when Dutch Dixon's crimes came to light and he was forced to go on the run.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Dutch Dixon confessed to several crimes on a tape which was heard by Dixon's boss Federal Marshall Jack Hendricks. Dixon shot Hendricks and his own son before escaping. The series ended with Reno and Bobby driving off in the sunset to find the wanted fugitive, Donald Dixon.
